testHelp

Class OutputInfo

  • Object
    • OutputInfo

  • class OutputInfo
extends Object
    An internal (package-private) class which holds data accumulated and used in ConsoleTester.getOutput and Assertion classes and provides methods for printing the data. It is not possible to access the data or call the printing methods directly in testHelp-based unittest code, but the functionality is generally available via calls to public methods in other testHelp classes and interfaces, particularly ConsoleTester and AssertionUtils.

    The printing methods can be called directly in tests, but they are normally called indirectly through methods in other classes/interfaces, which in turn may be called directly in tests but are normally called internally within the other classes/interfaces.

    Three static methods, which print only data stored in OutputInfo (or more exactly, in info), are indirectly callable through corresponding public static methods in public class ConsoleTester:

    • printTestClassName(PrintStream out) - ConsoleTester.printTestClassNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted()
    • printTestName(PrintStream out) - ConsoleTester.printTestNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted()
    • printInfo(PrintStream out) - ConsoleTester.printInfoIfNotAlreadyPrinted()

    Three other static methods, which print passed in messages along with data stored in OutputInfo, are indirectly callable through corresponding public static methods in public interface AssertionTools:

    • printFailMessage(PrintStream out, String message) - AssertionTools.fail(String message) and AssertionTools.failF(String format, Object[] args)
    • printWarningMessage(PrintStream out, String message) - AssertionTools.warning(String message) and AssertionTools.warningF(String format, Object[] args)
    • printInfoMessage(PrintStream out, String message) - AssertionTools.info(String message) and AssertionTools.infoF(String format, Object[] args)
    Examples of outputs from all the print methods can be seen in the file test/testHelp/SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests-output.txt, was generated by running test/testHelp/SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java as a junit test under eclipse and saving the console output.
    Author:
    John Armstrong

    • Field Detail

      • testNum

        static int testNum
        The number of the last test detected. Starts at zero, is incremented each time a new test is detected.

        Persists for lifetime of unittest run under normal junit operation where test class is loaded only once.

      • info

        static OutputInfo info
        Static reference to the one and only instance (at any time) of an OutputInfo object.

      • testClassCallerClassName

        static final String testClassCallerClassName
        Used in diagnostics that identify caller of test method - used by getTestNameInfo().
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • testNameInfo

        OutputInfo.TestNameInfo testNameInfo
        object containing test name info for current test.

      • value

        Object value
        return value from vFunction or vUnBoundMethod when called within getOutput method, otherwise null

      • exception

        Throwable exception
        set by getOutputFromException called directly or within bundled getOutput method when there is an exception, otherwise null.

      • description

        String description
        An optional description, passed in a call to a getOutput method, of what is being run.

        Printed by printInfo as "DESCRIPTION: " plus value or '[null]' if not set

      • input

        String input
        The input string passed to getOutputStart and bundled getOutput methods that calls it.

        Printed by printInfo as "INPUT: " + value.

      • output

        String output
        The string returned by by a getOutput method, normally assigned to a variable that can be tested or otherwise used. Value will represent two different things depending on what happens in the getOutput call:
        • Successful completion: captured output to System.out - returned by bundled getOutput or unbundled getOutputFinish - printed by printInfo as "INPUT: " + value
        • Exception thrown: string representation of the exception - returned by bundled getOutput or unbundled getOutputFromException - printed by printInfo as "INPUT [EXCEPTION]: " + value.

        Note: this behavior is for backwards compatibility with the original version of testHelp.

      • outputBeforeException

        String outputBeforeException
        Captured output to System.out up to the point when an exception is thrown.

        Printed as "OUTPUT [BEFORE EXCEPTION]: " + value for an excweption thrown by code being tested or "OUTPUT [BEFORE INTERNAL EXCEPTION]: " + value for an exception thrown within the testHelp framework.

      • errorOutput

        String errorOutput
        Captured output to System.err. Is not printed, but is used to make chunkedErrorOutput, which is printed.

      • errorAndExceptionSummary

        String errorAndExceptionSummary
        Currently not used.

      • chunkedErrorOutput

        String chunkedErrorOutput
        Captured output to Systenm.err as chunked by the ErrorOutputChunker.

        Printed as "ERROROUTPUT: " + value.

      • getOutputInitialized

        boolean getOutputInitialized
        Internal flag.

    • Method Detail

      • getTestNameInfo

        static OutputInfo.TestNameInfo getTestNameInfo()
        Gets a new fully initialized TestNameInfo object for currently running test.

        Uses a heuristic to find the currently running test - immediate caller is sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0().

        Important note: will fail with exception if not called within a test in a unittest running under junit.

        Returns:
        new TestestNameInfo object
        Throws:
        TestHelpError - if a test cannot be found on stack

      • sync

        static void sync()
        Ensures that the singleton OutputInfo object stored in static field info is up-to-date

      • flushPrintStreams

        static void flushPrintStreams(PrintStream out)
        Flushes specified Printstream. If PrintStream is System.out or System.err, flushes both of them in that order. Purpose of flushing both System output streams is to avoid overlapping outputs. The method also includes a 20 msec sleep to mitigate a multithreading race condition between System.out and System.err printing in the eclipse console.
        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream to flush.

      • printTestClassName

        void printTestClassName(PrintStream out)
        Prints the testClassName in the following form: 
          ==========================================================================================

  TEST CLASS: testHelp.SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests
        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream to write to - normally System.out

      • printTestClassNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted

        void printTestClassNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted(PrintStream out)
        Calls printTestClassName(PrintStream) if not already called - Should print once per test file, at the top of the output to System.out.
        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream to write to - normally System.out

      • printTestName

        void printTestName(PrintStream out)
        Prints the number, name and file location of the test in the following format: 
          ==========================================================================================

  TEST (1): test_printTestName (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:32)
        Note that the parenthesized filename:linenumber is clickable in the eclipse console and when clicked will shift focus to the file and linenumber.
        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream to print to - normally System.out

      • printTestNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted

        void printTestNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted(PrintStream out)
        Calls printTestName(PrintStream) if it has not already been called for the current test, else does nothing.

        Whether or not this should be called is determined in the calling environment as it depends on both the situation and the verboseLevel

        Parameters:
        out - - PrintStream to print to - normally System.out

      • printInfo

        void printInfo(PrintStream out)
        Prints all appropriate fields in the form <label>: <value>. The following is a full list of the items that may be appear:

        • DESCRIPTION: description - description of what is being run in the test - set in the desc or descArg argument in a bundled getOutput.. or unbundled getOutputStart call, or optionally by ConsoleTester.setDescription in tests where no getOutput method is called
        • INPUT: input - the input string in a bundled getOutput call
        • OUTPUT: output - captured output to System.out in a bundled or unbundled getOutput call that completes without throwing an exception - value will be the string returned by bundled getOutput or unbundled getOutputFinish
        • OUTPUT [BEFORE EXCEPTION] or [BEFORE INTERNAL EXCEPTION]: outputBeforeException- captured output to System.out in a bundled or unbundled getOutput call before an except is thrown
        • OUTPUT [EXCEPTION]: output - a string representation of exception thrown in a bundled opr unbundled getOut call - value will be the string returned by bundled getOutput.. or unbundled getOutputFromException
        • VALUE: value - the simple classname and string representation of value returned within a bundled output call or "[not set]" in an unbundled call - a value "VoidR voidR" indicates that executed method had void return type
        • ERROR_OUTPUT: chunkedErrorOutput - captured output to System.err in a bundled or unbundled getOutput call including exception traces and other outour - will be parsed into possibly truncated chunks by the ErrorOutputChunker

        Note that the only value that is printed when no bundled or unbundled getOutput methods have been called is description, abd a value will be printed only after ConsoleTester.setDescription has been called in the test. Doing so is useful for attaching a description to tests that don't use getOutput, for example tests that get some value and then test it using verify methods.

        Parameters:
        out - - PrintStream to print to - normally System.out

      • printInfoIfNotAlreadyPrinted

        void printInfoIfNotAlreadyPrinted(PrintStream out)
        Calls printInfo if it has not already been called for the current test, else does nothing.
        Parameters:
        out - - PrintStream to print to - normally System.out

      • printFailMessage

        static void printFailMessage(PrintStream out,
                             String message)
        Prints assertion failure message in the following form:
        • printed directly
          ASSERTION FAILURE (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:272): Fail message printed with verify.fail
        or:
        • printed from within and assertion class
         
  ASSERTION FAILURE (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:285): Expected actual number 43 to be equalTo expected number 42 but was not

  ASSERTION FAILURE (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:298): Expected 22/7 3.142857 to be within tolerance 0.000100 of pi 3.141593 but it was not

  ASSERTION FAILURE (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:311): Expected string [foo] to be equal to string [food] but is not

  ASSERTION FAILURE (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:325): Expected to find pattern 'food' but did not in string 'some foo for you'

        Note that this method only prints a message, it does not throw a java.lang.AssertionError exception.

        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream to print to - normally System.out
        message - message to print

      • printWarningMessage

        static void printWarningMessage(PrintStream out,
                                String message)
        Prints warning message to output stream in the following form: 
          ASSERTION WARNING (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:251): Warning message printed with verify.info
        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream to print to - normally System.out
        message - message to print

      • printInfoMessage

        static void printInfoMessage(PrintStream out,
                             String message)
        Prints info message in the following form: 
          ASSERTION INFO (SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java:239): Info message printed with verify.info
        Parameters:
        out - PrintStream to print to - normally System.out
        message - message to print
